page.title: 04EMPLOYMENT
page.content: Farms in Crosshill are owner-occupied and worked by the family as are the garage,post office and local hotels. A few men are employed by the water board but most of the village work force commutes to Maybole,Ayr and Irvine.Many are tradesmen,some are in a profession,a small number are unemployed.There are a few working mothers.Some are child minders caring for the pre-school children of mothers who work in shops or offices.A creamery just outside Kirkmichael closed in 1983 and a lot of people lost their jobs.The building is now a warehouse for toiletries for a chain of chemist shops in Ayrshire,employing 17 people.The only other local work is in the two shops,two pubs and one restaurant.Others commute to Ayr,Maybole,Prestwick,Irvine and one travels as far as Glasgow.
